articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance by "Orchestra of 21st Century"
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Performance by "Orchestra of 21st Century" 
Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Wednesday enjoyed a performance given by the "Orchestra of the 21st Century" of Russia on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The orchestra made up of people's and merited artistes and international concours winners and other famous conductors, vocalists and instrumentalists of Russia put on the stage such colorful numbers as chorus and orchestral music "Where are you, comrade-in-arms now", male trio "It's time to leave", male solo and chorus "Tribute to that great period", chorus and dance "Kalinka", male solo "From where the country begins", female solo "Blue handkerchief", female folk solo "Willow", chorus and bayan solo "In the forest near the front", violin solo "Chardash", chorus "Day of victory", Korean songs "Where Are You, Dear General" and "My Home Village."
					
					 Through the performance the Russian artistes truthfully represented with high artistry the ardent love of the Russian people for their motherland, traditional custom and national emotion. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il sent a floral basket to them, congratulating them on their successful presentation.
					
					 Among the audience were Secretaries Choe Thae Bok and Kim Ki Nam, Department Directors Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek and Kim Yong Il of the Central Committee of the WPK, Kang Sok Ju, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other leading officials and officials in the fields of literature and arts and media.

articles.title: Kim Jung Rin Dies
articles.content:
Kim Jung Rin Dies
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Jung Rin, member of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and secretary of the Party Central Committee, died of cardiac infraction on April 28 at the age of 86.
					 Born in a poor peasant's family in Usi County, Jagang Province, on December 7, Juche 12 (1923), he grew up to be an able official under the care of President Kim Il Sung after the liberation of the country and devotedly worked for the Party and the revolution, the country and the people.
					
					 Holding the post as instructor of the Party Central Committee since 1952 and then as section chief and vice department director and department director and then secretary of the C.C., the WPK for years, he devoted himself to the work for the strengthening and development of the Party and the revolutionary ranks and the victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche. 
					
					 He was elected alternate member of the Party Central Committee in 1961 and since worked as member of its guiding body for a long period. He was active as deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly since the third SPA in 1962.  
					
					 He received Kim Il Sung Order, the highest order of the Republic, and Order of the National Flag First Class and many other state citations in recognition of the feats performed for the Party and the revolution, the country and its people. 
					
					 An obituary of Kim Jung Rin was jointly issued by the C.C., the WPK and the Presidium of the SPA of the DPRK today. 
					
					 The obituary said that he devoted all his wisdom and enthusiasm to the struggle for strengthening the Party organizationally and ideologically, consolidating the single-minded unity of the Party and the masses, achieving national reunification and boosting the international solidarity with the revolution, remaining true to the leadership of Kim Jong Il from long ago. The feats performed by Kim Jung Rin for the Party and the revolution, the country and its people will remain long, it added. 
					
					 The Central Committee of the WPK and the Presidium of the SPA of the DPRK announced that the late Kim Jung Rin would be accorded a state funeral and formed a state funeral committee with Jon Pyong Ho as its chairman and Kim Yong Il, Kim Yong Chun, Ri Yong Mu and 37 others as its members. 
					
					 The state funeral committee informed that the bier of the deceased would be placed in the Sojang Hall, Pothonggang District, Pyongyang, and receive mourners from 10:00 to 20:00 on April 29 and the hearse would leave the hall at 8 a.m. on April 30.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung University Boasts Its E-Library
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung University Boasts Its E-Library 
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Il Sung University, the highest seat of the Juche-based education, boasts its E-Library, an ultramodern education, science information service center. 
					The five-storied library has a total floor space of more than 15,000 square meters. It is on the world standard in terms of data base and service capacity.
					
					The data base of the library is rich in information about the whole of Korea and all countries of the world. It includes the works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, information about the revolutionary histories of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu, books, magazines and treatises in the fields of social science and natural science, scientific and technological books, magazines and excerpts from publications of different countries of the world, patented materials, and science films and special scientific and technological files and other animation files and programs.
					
					  The data base of the library will steadily gain in scope as it has all kinds of latest digital facilities capable of converting information into e-books and animation files.
					
					 All units of the university centered on the E-Library form a high-speed information circuit connected with a dense network of CDMA communication.
					
					  Having an academic and material and technological foundation for comprehensive and specialized service, the E-Library is operating tens of thousands of latest electronic equipment of more than 100 varieties in dozens of rooms including reading halls, IT service hall, multimedia reading hall, combined lecture hall and academic exchange room.
					
					All services ranging from catalogue browsing, book and information reading and lectures to taking care of readers have been placed on a scientific and IT basis under the system of e-library service and management and operation peculiar to the DPRK.
					
					  The library equipped with the latest stereophonic sound system, radio network system, projecting and other facilities can provide most convenient and ideal conditions for hosting international academic exchanges, scientific symposiums and presentations of treatises and other events.
					
					 As its lecture rooms are remote-controlled, students of the university and people in any other parts of the country can receive real time lectures or recorded ones.
					
					 There is in the library a special reading room for veteran professors.
					
					 The library is ideally based on formative and artistic architecture as required by its nature and mission and Juche-oriented architectural beauty.

articles.title: Korean People's Custom of Flower Cultivation
articles.content:
Korean People's Custom of Flower Cultivation
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Spring flower cultivation is in full swing at horticultural stations, industrial establishments and families in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The Pyongyang City Flower Cultivation Station and horticultural stations in all districts of the city have planted many species of flowers in parks and pleasure grounds and renewed flowerbeds and flowerpot stands.
					
					 From long ago, the Korean people have considered flower to be an important part of their emotional life.
					
					 In the period of three kingdoms (Koguryo, Paekje and Silla), the people made flower gardens in their courtyards and planted various species of seasonal flowers. They also raised flower and fruit trees in their villages to add to their beauty.
					
					 Folding screens with flower pictures were in full vogue in the period of Koryo. One of them portrays pine and oak trees and various shapes of flowerpots and vases with peony and other flowers.
					
					 Flowers are often seen in Koryo celadon and white porcelains in the period of Ri Dynasty.
					
					 Korean ancestors favored pancakes patterned with azalea and chrysanthemum and liquor brewed with them and liked quiz on flowers.
					
					 Flowers made of silk, paper and other materials were also popular in the country.

articles.title: Elimination of Leftovers of Cold War Era Called for
articles.content:
Elimination of Leftovers of Cold War Era Called for 
						
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- It presents itself as an urgent requirement of the times to eliminate the leftovers of the Cold War era on the Korean Peninsula at present, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed article.
					 The tense situation and danger of a war prevailing on the peninsula are attributable to such leftovers of the Cold War era as the Korean Armistice Agreement (AA) and the U.S.-south Korea "Mutual Defense Treaty", the article says, and goes on:
					
					 They should have been eliminated from the peninsula along with the demise of the Cold War.
					
					 The tense situation in the region is just like a time bomb ready to go off any moment as it poses a constant threat to peace and security in Northeast Asia and, furthermore, in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 Only when the leftovers of the Cold War era are eliminated from the peninsula is it possible to turn it into a peace zone free from the danger of a war, stabilize the situation in Northeast Asia and create conditions and environment favorable for peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The replacement of the AA by a peace treaty is a precondition for defusing the hostile relations between the DPRK and the U.S. and, furthermore, averting a war and bringing peace to the peninsula.
					
					 How to approach the issue of concluding a peace treaty serves as a touchstone judging whether one stands for lasting peace of the world including the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Asia or not.
					
					 The U.S. should make a bold decision to fulfill its responsibility for eliminating the leftovers of the Cold War era from the peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. will stand more bitterly rejected and censured internally and externally and invite international isolation and destruction if it tries to keep them, persistently turning away from the voices of the Korean and other peoples of the world demanding their earlier elimination.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Derailing Tour of Mt. Kumgang
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Derailing Tour of Mt. Kumgang
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- How to approach the tour of Mt. Kumgang precisely means an attitude toward the north-south relations, and to block the tour is little short of denying the national reconciliation and cooperation and the improved inter-Korean relations, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed article.
					 The north-south relations are inching close to an uncontrollable catastrophe with each passing day due to the south Korean authorities' unreasonable refusal to resume the tour of Mt. Kumgang, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is deplorable, indeed, that the tour has been pushed to the phase of catastrophe due to the present south Korean authorities' deliberate obstructions even though it had been underway for over a decade, injecting fresh energy into the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 The south Korean conservative forces, displeased with the national reconciliation and cooperation and the improved north-south relations, have desperately blocked the tour of Mt. Kumgang with a negative approach toward it. This threw a hurdle in the way of national reconciliation and cooperation and pushed the inter-Korean relations to graver catastrophe.
					
					 The anti-reunification moves of the south Korean authorities threw the tour of Mt. Kumgang into the worst crisis. Under this situation the Korean people have drawn the conclusion that the inter-Korean relations can never be improved unless the conservative group rolls back its anti-reunification and confrontational policy.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group will have to pay a dear price for having doggedly stood in the way of the tour to be deprived of the hard-won opportunity of improving the north-south relations.

articles.title: Full Display of Spirit of Songun Korea Called for
articles.content:
Full Display of Spirit of Songun Korea Called for
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- The construction sites of the Huichon Power Station are symbolic of the country making a  leap forward  in the dynamic drive for building a thriving nation in the spirit of Songun Chollima and serve as a banner encouraging the army and people of the DPRK in their efforts to perform heroic feats, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an editorial.
					The soldier-builders in Huichon and other builders of the power station are bringing about new miracles and innovations day by day in the spirit of devotedly implementing the leader's instructions, the spirit of flattening even a high mountain at one go if required by the Party, the editorial notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is in the construction sites of the power station that the matchless offensive spirit of the great brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu is running high and the strong mental power of Kim Il Sung's nation knowing no impossibility is given full play.  The soldier-builders and other builders in Huichon have carried out in a matter of several months the vast project, which would have taken several years at an ordinary pace, by racing against the time. This miracle can be performed only by servicepersons and people in the DPRK carving out a bright future by making an epoch-making leap forward.
					
					 Every minute and second in the construction sites of the Huichon Power Station witness the speed of advance for a great surge and eye-opening achievements are being reported from different parts of the country thanks to the enterprising and creative work style of the builders. 
					
					 Inexhaustible is the strength of the servicepersons and people of the DPRK rallied close around the Party and optimistic is their future, the editorial says, calling upon all of them to fully display the spirit of Songun Korea making a leap forward in the construction of the Huichon Power Station under the leadership of the great Party and bring earlier the final victory in the drive for building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Vietnam DM to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Vietnam DM to DPRK Embassy

articles.title: Chongryon Calls for Intensifying National Education
articles.content:
Chongryon Calls for Intensifying National Education
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- A conference for making this year a year of intensifying national education was held at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on April 25.
					 Present there were Ho Jong Man, chief vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and other officials and educational workers of Chongryon.
					
					Ho Jong Man said in his report that President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il regarded national education as the lifeline of the movement of Koreans in Japan and made tireless efforts for the development of national education of Chongryon.
					
					 The Chongryon organization and the patriotic movement today would be unthinkable without national education which has a well-regulated system from primary schools to a university under the profound loving care of the President and Kim Jong Il, he said, and continued:
					
					 In order to usher in a new heyday in the movement of Koreans in Japan in 2012 marking the centenary of birth of the President, all the officials of Chongryon should preserve and develop in practice the national education, the starting-point in the organizational construction and patriotic activities, bearing the idea and intention of Kim Jong Il deep in their minds.
					
					 The speakers declared they would strive to make a breakthrough towards ushering in a new heyday in the national education, to begin with, keeping pace with the people in the homeland performing heroic feats in the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Actions against Discrimination Policy Staged in Japan
articles.content:
Actions against Discrimination Policy Staged in Japan
						
 Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Actions against the national discrimination policy of the Japanese authorities were staged in different parts of Japan by Korean residents in Japan including parents of students and Japanese personages.
					 A meeting of mothers in the area of Aichi Korean Senior High School took place at Nagoya Korean Primary School on April 10.
					
					 Speakers at the meeting said it is evidently a violation of the law and a revelation of Japan's constant discrimination policy that the Japanese authorities have excluded only Korean schools from the tuition-free program for senior high schools.
					
					 The Japanese authorities should include Korean schools in the program in view of reparation for the past crimes, they said, expressing the will to intensify the struggle for it.
					
					 Members of the executive committee of the "emergency action against exclusion of Korean schools from the tuition-free program for senior high schools" held a meeting on April 16 after conveying the resolution and signature paper adopted at its March 27 meeting to the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology.
					
					 They demanded that the Japanese authorities not trample down upon the future of Korean students in Japan but include Korean schools in the tuition-free program and renounce the discrimination policy at once.
					
					 They called for lifting louder voice of solidarity to force the Japanese authorities to drop the policy of discriminating against Korean schools.
					
					 The chief director of the Fukuoka Korean Academy and others concerned of Korean schools and the vice-chairman and members of the Fukuoka Prefectural Japan-DPRK Friendship Association conveyed the letter of request and the 25,000-odd people signature paper addressed to the prime minister and the minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan to the Democratic Party of Japan and the above-said ministry separately on April 20.

articles.title: Day of Sun Commemorated
articles.content:
Day of Sun Commemorated
Pyongyang, April 28 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Bangladesh, France and Democratic Congo and seminars in Pakistan, Colombia, Ethiopia and Bangladesh between April 8 and 15 to commemorate the Day of the Sun.
					 Speeches were made there. 
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist), the president of the Bangladesh People's League and other speakers noted that thanks to the brilliant ideological and theoretical activities and revolutionary practices of President Kim Il Sung the DPRK turned into a powerful socialist state and the international anti-imperialist independent forces grew stronger. They highly praised the President as the great leader of the Korean people and the world's revolutionary people striving to realize independence.
					
					 The delegate president of the France-Korea Friendship Association said that the life of Kim Il Sung was the noble life devoted to the country and the people and global peace and security.
					
					 The chairman of the National Committee of the Genuine Lumumbist Patriotic Party of Democratic Congo lauded the whole life of Kim Il Sung who pioneered the Juche cause with his gifted wisdom and unique idea and guided the country along the road of independence and prosperity and provided the foundation for genuine freedom and happiness to the Korean people with his distinguished leadership ability and through his giant revolutionary practices.
					
					 The general secretary of the Punjab Provincial Committee of the National Workers' Party of Pakistan stressed that Kim Il Sung devoted all his life to the work for the people's happiness and prosperity of the country.
					
					 The president of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea "Kanggye" of Colombia said it is Kim Il Sung who provided the historic roots of the Songun politics serving as the symbol of dignity and honor of socialist Korea and treasured sword of invincibility.

Enviado cesto de flores a la embajada coreana en Vietnam

articles.title: Eliminacion de residuos de guerra fria es tarea urgente de la epoca
articles.content:
Eliminacion de residuos de guerra fria es tarea urgente de la epoca
Pyongyang, 28 de abril (ATCC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un articulo individual difundido el dia 28, destaca que hoy dia, la liquidacion de los residuos de guerra fria en la Peninsula Coreana es la tarea apremiante de la epoca.
					Entre esos residuos figuran el Acuerdo de Armisticio de Corea, el Tratado de Defensa Mutua Estados Unidos-Sur de Corea, etc. que generan continuamente en la Peninsula Coreana la tension y los riesgos de guerra, dijo el articulista y continuo:
					
					Esos residuos debieron ser liquidados ya en la Peninsula Coreana con el fin de guerra fria.
					
					La aguda situacion creada en esta region es igual a la bomba de tiempo a punto de explotar que amenaza persistentemente la paz y la seguridad del Nordeste Asiatico y, a la larga,  la region de Asia-Pacifico.
					
					Cuando sean liquidados los residuos de la epoca de guerra fria, sera posible convertir la Peninsula Coreana en una zona pacifica sin peligros de guerra y procurar las condiciones y el clima favorables a estabilizar la situacion del Nordeste Asiatico y a garantizar la paz y la seguridad de Asia y el resto del mundo.
					
					La sustitucion del acuerdo de armisticio por el otro de paz es la condicion sine qua non para acabar con las relaciones hostiles entre la RPDC y EE.UU., prevenir la guerra y preservar la paz en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					La actitud y la posicion sobre el particular resultan la pauta para distinguir a los que desean la paz permanente de la Peninsula Coreana, el resto de Asia y el mundo y a los que no la desean.
					
					EE.UU. debe tomar la valiente decision de cumplir su responsabilidad asumida en la eliminacion de residuos de la epoca de guerra fria existentes en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Si el imperio pretende mantener y fortalecer los vestigios de guerra fria desoyendo la demanda del pueblo coreano y de los demas del mundo de liquidarlos cuanto antes, sera condenado y repudiado mas por dentro y por fuera y acelerara su aislamiento en la arena internacional y destruccion.

articles.title: Biblioteca electronica de la Universidad Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Biblioteca electronica de la Universidad Kim Il Sung
						
Pyongyang, 28 de abril (ATCC) -- La biblioteca electronica de la Universidad Kim Il Sung, centro supremo de la educacion del Juche, fue acondicionada como base de servicio de informaciones pedagogicas y cientificas en el nivel sofisticado.
					  Este edificio de cinco pisos ocupa una superficie arquitectonica de mas de 15 mil metros cuadrados y tiene el gran tamano de archivos y la capacidad de servicio de talla mundial.
					
					  En los archivos esta depositada una enorme cantidad de datos de Corea y el resto del mundo incluyendo las obras del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, los datos sobre la historia revolucionaria de los tres generales del monte Paektu (estos dos grandes hombres y la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk), los libros, las revistas y las tesis de las ciencias sociales y naturales, los libros cientifico-tecnicos, las revistas, los epitomes, las patentes, los documentales cientificos, las ediciones especiales cientificas y tecnicas, los multimedias y programas de varios paises.
					
					  La base se ampliara ilimitadamente gracias a los modernos equipos de digitalizacion que convierten los datos en los libros electronicos y los multimedias.
					
					  Fue formada una autopista de informaciones que une mediante un WAN a todas las unidades de la Universidad teniendo en su centro la biblioteca electronica.
					
					  Decenas de miles de equipos electronicos ultramodernos de mas de 100 tipos estan instaladas en decenas de salones, incluyendo los de lectura y de servicio de informaciones, la sala de multimedias, el aula de multiproposito y el salon de intercambio academico.
					
					  Gracias al original sistema de servicio y administracion de la biblioteca, se puede realizar de manera cientifica e informatizada todas las labores como la busqueda de catalogo, la lectura de libros y datos, la impartida de lecciones y la administracion de lectores.
					
					  La biblioteca dotada de ultramoderno sistema sonico estereografico, red de comunicaciones inalambricas e instrumentos de proyeccion, etc. sera el lugar mas comodo e ideal para las reuniones internacionales de intercambio academico, el seminario cientifico y la publicacion de disertaciones y otros foros.
					
					  La sala de leccion a larga distancia, equipada con todos los equipos ultramodernos, permitira a los estudiantes y los trabajadores recibir las lecciones en vivo o mediante grabaciones de video desde sus planteles o cualquier otra parte donde se encuentren.
					
					  En particular, ahi esta acondicionada una sala de lectura para el uso exclusivo de los profesores viejos.
					
					  La biblioteca electronica fue construida satisfaciendo la demanda de la autoctona arquitectura y estetica y los requisitos formativos y artisticos conforme a su caracter y mision.

articles.title: Cultivo de flores en Corea
articles.content:
Cultivo de flores en Corea
Pyongyang, 28 de abril (ATCC) -- En esta estacion primaveral, las empresas forestales, las fabricas, las empresas y las familias de Corea estan enfrascadas en el cuidado de jardines y el cultivo de flores.
					La empresa de produccion de flores de la ciudad de Pyongyang y otras empresas floricolas municipales diversifican las especies de flores plantadas en los parques y los lugares de recreo y arreglan jardines y macetas.
					
					Desde la antiguedad, la nacion coreana amaba mucho las flores considerandolas como elemento importante de su vida cultural y simbolo de hermosura y pureza.
					
					Los antecesores de la epoca de los 3 reinos formaron jardines en patios, cuidaron muchas especies de flores segun las estaciones del ano y hermosearon el paisaje de las aldeas plantando por doquier los arboles floriferos y frutales.
					
					En la epoca de Coryo, estaban de moda los biombos de flores, entre los cuales se destaca el famoso de 4 estaciones en que aparecen pintados el pino y la encina, las macetas y floreros de varias formas con endrino, flor de peonia, etc.
					
					Hay numerosas porcelanas de verdeceledon de Coryo, las blancas de la dinastia de los Ri y otros articulos artesanales que describieron la flor.
					
					Los antecesores preferian los alimentos relacionados con la flor como la fritura de azalea, el licor hecho con flores de azalea, etc.
					
					Igualmente, realizaban los juegos folcloricos como el de adivinar el nombre de las flores.
					
					Frente a la creciente demanda de las flores, aparecieron las entidades y los artesanos que fabricaban las flores con varios materiales como seda y papel.
